title: Ornamental mat, perhaps for a pillow Beaded pillow mat
content:
accession_no_csv: 2016-00417

  Image: 

  object_work_type: pillow shams

  title_text: Ornamental mat
 perhaps for a pillow Beaded pillow mat

  preference: main alternate

  title_language: 

  creation_date: c. 1900

  creation_place_original_location: Java (Indonesia)

  styles_periods_indexing_terms: Peranakan

  inscriptions: 

  inscription_language: 

  shape: rectangular

  materials_name: glass (material) velvet (fabric weave) gold thread

  techniques_name: sewing (needleworking technique) embroidering

  object_colour: multicolored

  physical_appearance: This is a beaded ornamental mat. It is made of a brown silk velvet textile
 decorated with embroidery of coloured beads. In the center medallion
 there is a embroided lotus flower and two butterflies. There are two birds on either side of the medallion. The lotus and butterfly motifs are repeated around the outside on the four corners.

  subject_terms_1: beadwork (visual works) Peranakan ornaments birds (motifs) lotus (motif)

  subject_terms_2: Motifs Pillow shams Peranakan (Asian people) Beadwork Decoration and ornament

  subject_terms_3: Decorative arts

  sgcool_label_text: This panel is composed symmetrically. Contained in the central medallion are a lotus flower and two butterflies. It is a fine example of early Nyonya needlework where motifs are symmetrically arranged around a central bouquet of flowers. Its size suggests it may have been a pillow decoration for the bridal bed.

metadata.title_text: Ornamental mat, perhaps for a pillow Beaded pillow mat
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a beaded ornamental mat. It is made of a brown silk velvet textile, decorated with embroidery of coloured beads. In the center medallion, there is a embroided lotus flower and two butterflies. There are two birds on either side of the medallion. The lotus and butterfly motifs are repeated around the outside on the four corners.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This panel is composed symmetrically. Contained in the central medallion are a lotus flower and two butterflies. It is a fine example of early Nyonya needlework where motifs are symmetrically arranged around a central bouquet of flowers. Its size suggests it may have been a pillow decoration for the bridal bed.
